CatDescriptText: James Lewis, 1603 Girard Avenue, East Pittsburgh, and Norman Peoples, 3200 Jane Street, were part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 5, 1957, pg. 2 with question: "Should ministers take an active part in politics? Do you believe that they should hold public office?" James Lewis' answer reads: "No, I think that it is wrong for a minister to be active in politics.  Politics, in my estimation, is gambling, and no minister has the right to do that.  Politicians and ministry just do not go together."  Norman Peoples' answer reads: "The way things are I think they should participate in politics.  More of our people, including ministers, should run for public office."
TitMainTitle: James Lewis wearing dark zippered leather jacket, plaid shirt, and holding cigar, standing next to Norman Peoples, on sidewalk with covered truck parked in street on right
